_header: There was a man of stature big
_description: ‘A curious Legend of St. Christopher’ — twenty-six lines in long-line couplets

CULAdd2604.First Lines:
There was a man of stature bigge and bigge withall in mindeFor
                    serve he would yet one than whom he greater none might findHe hearing that
                    the Emperor was in the World most greatCame to his Court was entertayned
                    and serving him at Meat…
CULAdd2604.Last Lines:
…So through Humilitie his Soul to Christ was reconcildeAnd of
                    his Carriage Christo-fer should thence forth be his name
CULAdd2604.Note:
Added in a nineteenth-century hand, ‘William
                    Warner’.
CULAdd2604.Attributed Title: A curious Legend of St Christopher (f. xxxi)
